subject: Question about 23, 24, 25
msgSnippet: I m curious letters 23, 24, and 25. The sounds they represent are (to me) consonants. It seems odd that these three were designed without risers or descenders.
messageBody:
I'm curious letters 23, 24, and 25. The sounds they represent are (to
me) consonants. It seems odd that these three were designed without
risers or descenders.

More/disclaimer/etc:

In my spoken speech, each ends with the tongue in contact with part
of the palate or teeth:

'n' : front and middle of the tongue with the front of the palate
'l' : front on the palate, sides of the front of the tongue on the
forward upper teeth
'r' : sides of the tongue on inside of the the back upper teeth

Though now that I voice these, I see that they all start with some
aspiration -- but then, so do 21 'ng' and 22 'm'.

Maybe a gray area? Whatever -- just curious. I'll learn them as they
are. It would have been simpler for me to memorize them if they'd
been considered more like consonants than vowels.

thanks
scrib
